content:
DataGridViewColumn Class

Definition

Represents a column in a DataGridView control.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.Designer("System.Windows.Forms.Design.DataGridViewColumnDesigner, System.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")]
[System.ComponentModel.DesignTimeVisible(false)]
[System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItem(false)]
[System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter(typeof(System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnConverter))]
public class DataGridViewColumn : System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewBand, IDisposable, System.ComponentModel.IComponent
Inheritance
Object
DataGridViewElement
System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewBand
DataGridViewColumn

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)

DataGridView
RaiseCellClick(DataGridViewCellEventArgs)
RaiseCellContentClick(DataGridViewCellEventArgs)
RaiseCellContentDoubleClick(DataGridViewCellEventArgs)
RaiseCellValueChanged(DataGridViewCellEventArgs)
RaiseDataError(DataGridViewDataErrorEventArgs)
RaiseMouseWheel(MouseEventArgs)
State

Remarks

The DataGridViewColumn class represents a logical column in a DataGridView control. You can retrieve columns through the Columns collection of the control.

Unlike a DataGridViewRow, which contains the actual collection of cells in a DataGridView, DataGridViewColumn is used mainly to adjust the appearance and behavior of the column user interface (UI), such as column width and cell style. For more information about cell styles, see Cell Styles in the Windows Forms DataGridView Control.

Types that derive from DataGridViewColumn typically initialize the CellTemplate property to a new instance of a related type derived from the DataGridViewCell class. Any column properties that relate to the appearance or behavior of individual cells are wrappers for the corresponding properties of the template cell. Changing one of these properties on the column automatically changes the value on the cell template and on all cells in the column. To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.

Constructors

DataGridViewColumn()

Initializes a new instance of the DataGridViewColumn class to the default state.

public DataGridViewColumn ();

DataGridViewColumn(DataGridViewCell)

Initializes a new instance of the DataGridViewColumn class using an existing DataGridViewCell as a template.

public DataGridViewColumn (System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell cellTemplate);
cellTemplate
DataGridViewCell

An existing DataGridViewCell to use as a template.

Remarks

This constructor sets the CellTemplate property to the value of the cellTemplate parameter.

Properties

AutoSizeMode

Gets or sets the mode by which the column automatically adjusts its width.

public System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode AutoSizeMode { get; set; }
Value
DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode

A DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode value that determines whether the column will automatically adjust its width and how it will determine its preferred width. The default is DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode.

Exceptions
InvalidEnumArgumentException

The specified value when setting this property is a DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode that is not valid.

InvalidOperationException

The specified value when setting this property results in an stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.InheritedAutoSizeMode* value of DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode for a visible column when column headers are hidden.

-or-

The specified value when setting this property results in an stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.InheritedAutoSizeMode* value of DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode for a visible column that is frozen.

Remarks

The automatic sizing behavior of the column is determined by the value of the InheritedAutoSizeMode property, which is the same as the value of the AutoSizeMode property for all values except DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode, which indicates that the value is inherited from the AutoSizeColumnsMode property instead.

When the InheritedAutoSizeMode property value is DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode, the column is resized along with other columns in that mode. All fill-mode columns in the control divide the available space in proportions determined by their FillWeight property values. The width available for fill mode is determined by subtracting the widths of all other columns from the width of the client area of the control. If this width is smaller than the combined MinimumWidth values of all fill-mode columns, the horizontal scroll bar is displayed, all fill-mode columns are shown with their minimum widths, and user column-resizing is disabled. For more information about column fill mode, see Column Fill Mode in the Windows Forms DataGridView Control.

When the InheritedAutoSizeMode property is set to any other value except DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode, the column will manage its width so that its cell values are fully displayed without clipping. In content-based sizing modes, size adjustments occur whenever cell contents change or, if WrapMode is enabled, whenever row heights change. Some content-based sizing modes let you limit the size adjustment to the currently displayed rows in order to increase performance.

Only columns with a Visible property value of true are resized, and changing the visibility of a column does not cause resizing to occur. Additionally, when columns are set to automatically resize, the user cannot adjust the column widths with the mouse.

To adjust column widths programmatically, use the DataGridView control's AutoResizeColumn or AutoResizeColumns methods or set the column Width property.

For more information about content-based automatic sizing, see Sizing Options in the Windows Forms DataGridView Control.

CellTemplate

Gets or sets the template used to create new cells.

public virtual System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell CellTemplate { get; set; }
Value
DataGridViewCell

A DataGridViewCell that all other cells in the column are modeled after. The default is null.

Remarks

The constructors for the DataGridViewColumn class initialize this property. The default constructor sets the property to null; the other constructor copies the cell template from its parameter.

Note

Changing the properties of the cell template will not immediately affect the user interface (UI) of the column's existing cells. These changes are only apparent after the column is regenerated (for example, by sorting the column or through a call to the InvalidateColumn method).

CellType

Gets the run-time type of the cell template.

public Type CellType { get; }
Value
Type

The Type of the DataGridViewCell used as a template for this column. The default is null.

Remarks

The base type of the CellTemplate is DataGridViewCell. Use this property to determine the actual derived type.

ContextMenuStrip

Gets or sets the shortcut menu for the column.

public override System.Windows.Forms.ContextMenuStrip ContextMenuStrip { get; set; }
Value
ContextMenuStrip

The ContextMenuStrip associated with the current DataGridViewColumn. The default is null.

Remarks

The shortcut menu appears when a user clicks the right mouse button in the column's display area.

DataPropertyName

Gets or sets the name of the data source property or database column to which the DataGridViewColumn is bound.

public string DataPropertyName { get; set; }
Value
String

The case-insensitive name of the property or database column associated with the DataGridViewColumn.

Remarks

When the AutoGenerateColumns property is set to true, each column automatically sets its DataPropertyName property to the name of a property or database column in the data source specified by the DataSource property. This binding can also be performed manually, which is useful when you want to display only a subset of the properties or database columns available in the data source. In such cases, set the AutoGenerateColumns property to false, and then manually add each DataGridViewColumn, setting the value of each DataPropertyName property to the properties or database columns in the data source that you want to display.

DefaultCellStyle

Gets or sets the column's default cell style.

public override System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle DefaultCellStyle { get; set; }
Value
DataGridViewCellStyle

A DataGridViewCellStyle that represents the default style of the cells in the column.

Remarks

The DataGridView control displays its cells using the styles indicated by the cell InheritedStyle property, which inherits styles from other properties of type DataGridViewCellStyle. For cells in this column, the styles specified through the DefaultCellStyle property override the styles specified through the DefaultCellStyle property, but are overridden by the styles specified through the RowsDefaultCellStyle, AlternatingRowsDefaultCellStyle, DefaultCellStyle, and Style properties.

For more information, see Cell Styles in the Windows Forms DataGridView Control.

DisplayIndex

Gets or sets the display order of the column relative to the currently displayed columns.

public int DisplayIndex { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The zero-based position of the column as it is displayed in the associated DataGridView, or -1 if the band is not contained within a control.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElement.DataGridView* is not null and the specified value when setting this property is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the number of columns in the control.

-or-

stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElement.DataGridView* is null and the specified value when setting this property is less than -1.

-or-

The specified value when setting this property is equal to MaxValue.

Remarks

Unlike the Index property, the DisplayIndex property corresponds to the current position of the column as displayed by the user interface (UI). By default, each column's DisplayIndex is set to numbers of increasing order, which reflects the order in which they were added. The Visible property value does not affect the DisplayIndex value. To determine the display position of a column based on its visibility or other state, use the GetFirstColumn, GetLastColumn, or GetNextColumn method of the DataGridViewColumnCollection class.

Every column in the control has a unique DisplayIndex value. The values start with 0 and proceed in numerical order without skipping any values. When you change the DisplayIndex value for a column, the DisplayIndex values for other columns are changed to reflect the new order.

If the column has an associated DataGridView control, setting this property will cause the control to redraw itself.

DividerWidth

Gets or sets the width, in pixels, of the column divider.

public int DividerWidth { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The thickness, in pixels, of the divider (the column's right margin).

Remarks

This property is useful to provide a visual boundary between frozen columns and columns that can scroll. The extra edge is part of the current column, although it will take on the foreground color of the associated DataGridView. The extra edge does not extend the area in which users can double-click to automatically resize a column. To resize a column, the user must double-click on the boundary between the divider and the adjacent column.

FillWeight

Gets or sets a value that represents the width of the column when it is in fill mode relative to the widths of other fill-mode columns in the control.

public float FillWeight { get; set; }
Value
Single

A Single representing the width of the column when it is in fill mode relative to the widths of other fill-mode columns. The default is 100.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The specified value when setting this property is less than or equal to 0.

Remarks

When the InheritedAutoSizeMode property value is DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode, the column is resized along with other columns in that mode so that all visible columns in the control exactly fill the horizontal width of the available display area. All fill-mode columns in the control divide the available space in proportions determined by their FillWeight property values. For more information about column fill mode, see Column Fill Mode in the Windows Forms DataGridView Control.

The maximum sum of FillWeight values for all columns in a DataGridView control is 65535.

Frozen

Gets or sets a value indicating whether a column will move when a user scrolls the DataGridView control horizontally.

public override bool Frozen { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true to freeze the column; otherwise, false.

Remarks

When a column is frozen, all the columns to its left (or to its right in right-to-left languages) are frozen as well. The frozen and unfrozen columns form two groups. If column repositioning is enabled by setting the AllowUserToOrderColumns property to true, the user cannot drag a column from one group to the other.

HeaderCell

Gets or sets the DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell that represents the column header.

public System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell HeaderCell { get; set; }
Value
DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell

A DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell that represents the header cell for the column.

Remarks

The header of a column is typically used to display a column label. Depending on the current values of the SortMode and SelectionMode properties, users can also click the column header to sort or select the column.

HeaderText

Gets or sets the caption text on the column's header cell.

public string HeaderText { get; set; }
Value
String

A String with the desired text. The default is an empty string ("").

Remarks

This property is useful only when the column has an associated header cell. For more information, see the HeaderCellCore property.

Note

There is no corresponding header text property for rows. To display labels in row headers, you must handle the System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellPainting event and paint your own labels when ColumnIndex is -1.

InheritedAutoSizeMode

Gets the sizing mode in effect for the column.

public System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode InheritedAutoSizeMode { get; }
Value
DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode

The DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode value in effect for the column.

Remarks

The automatic sizing behavior of the column is determined by the value of the InheritedAutoSizeMode property, which is the same as the value of the AutoSizeMode property for all values except DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode, which indicates that the value is inherited from the AutoSizeColumnsMode property instead.

When the InheritedAutoSizeMode property value is DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode, the column is resized along with other columns in that mode so that all visible columns in the control exactly fill the horizontal width of the available display area. All fill-mode columns in the control divide the available space in proportions determined by their FillWeight property values. For more information about column fill mode, see Column Fill Mode in the Windows Forms DataGridView Control.

When the InheritedAutoSizeMode property is set to any other value except DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode, the column will manage its width so that its cell values are fully displayed without clipping. In content-based sizing modes, size adjustments occur whenever cell contents change or, if WrapMode is enabled, whenever row heights change. Some content-based sizing modes let you limit the size adjustment to the currently displayed rows in order to increase performance.

Only columns with a Visible property value of true are resized, and changing the visibility of a column does not cause resizing to occur. Additionally, when columns are set to automatically resize, the user cannot adjust the column widths with the mouse.

To adjust column widths programmatically, use the DataGridView control's AutoResizeColumn or AutoResizeColumns methods or set the column Width property.

For more information about content-based automatic sizing, see Sizing Options in the Windows Forms DataGridView Control.

InheritedStyle

Gets the cell style currently applied to the column.

public override System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle InheritedStyle { get; }
Value
DataGridViewCellStyle

A DataGridViewCellStyle that represents the cell style used to display the column.

Remarks

This property is useful to determine which cell styles are applied to all cells in a column regardless of any row styles that are also applied to the cells. The column InheritedStyle property inherits its values from the DefaultCellStyle and the DefaultCellStyle property.

For more information about cell style inheritance, see Cell Styles in the Windows Forms DataGridView Control.

IsDataBound

Gets a value indicating whether the column is bound to a data source.

public bool IsDataBound { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the column is connected to a data source; otherwise, false.

Remarks

A column becomes bound to a data source if it is part of a data-bound DataGridView. A column can become part of a data-bound DataGridView if the column is automatically created when the AutoGenerateColumns property is set to true, or if the column's DataPropertyName property is set when the column is manually added to the DataGridView.

MinimumWidth

Gets or sets the minimum width, in pixels, of the column.

public int MinimumWidth { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The number of pixels, from 2 to Int32, that specifies the minimum width of the column. The default is 5.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The value is less than 2 or greater than Int32.

Remarks

The MinimumWidth property sets a limit on how narrow the column can be resized in the user interface (UI). The Width property can override the MinimumWidth property.

Name

Gets or sets the name of the column.

public string Name { get; set; }
Value
String

A String that contains the name of the column. The default is an empty string ("").

Remarks

This property represents a formal name associated with the column that can be used to identify the column in a collection. For example, the Remove and Contains methods of the DataGridViewColumnCollection class use the Name property. The name is case-insensitive. The DataGridView will treat column1 and COLUMN1 as the same column.

ReadOnly

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user can edit the column's cells.

public override bool ReadOnly { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the user cannot edit the column's cells; otherwise, false.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

This property is set to false for a column that is bound to a read-only data source.

Remarks

The ReadOnly property affects the ReadOnly property of each cell in the column.

Resizable

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the column is resizable.

public override System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTriState Resizable { get; set; }
Value
DataGridViewTriState

One of the DataGridViewTriState values. The default is DataGridViewTriState.

Remarks

If the Resizable property is DataGridViewTriState, the user will not be able to manually adjust the column width.

By default, the Resizable property value is based on the AllowUserToResizeColumns property value. If you explicitly set Resizable to DataGridViewTriState or DataGridViewTriState, however, the control value is ignored. Set Resizable to DataGridViewTriState to restore the value-inheritance behavior.

Because DataGridViewTriState restores the value inheritance, the Resizable property will never return a DataGridViewTriState value unless the column has not been added to a DataGridView control. If you need to determine whether the Resizable property value of a column is inherited, check its State property. If the State property value includes the DataGridViewElementStates flag, the Resizable property value is not inherited.

Site

Gets or sets the site of the column.

public System.ComponentModel.ISite Site { get; set; }
Value
ISite

The ISite associated with the column, if any.

SortMode

Gets or sets the sort mode for the column.

public System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnSortMode SortMode { get; set; }
Value
DataGridViewColumnSortMode

A DataGridViewColumnSortMode that specifies the criteria used to order the rows based on the cell values in a column.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The value assigned to the property conflicts with stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.SelectionMode*.

Remarks

When a DataGridView control is sorted using a column with a SortMode property value of DataGridViewColumnSortMode, a sorting glyph is automatically displayed in the column header.

Starting in the .NET Framework 4.6, the sorting glyph is resized according to the system DPI settings when the app.config file contains the following entry: 

<appSettings>  
  <add key="EnableWindowsFormsHighDpiAutoResizing" value="true" />  
</appSettings>

When the control is sorted using a column with a SortMode property value of DataGridViewColumnSortMode, you must display the sorting glyph yourself through the SortGlyphDirection property.

The default sort mode of a DataGridViewTextBoxColumn is DataGridViewColumnSortMode. The default sort mode for other column types is DataGridViewColumnSortMode.

The SortMode value does not prevent you from sorting a column programmatically, although other restrictions may apply. For more information, see the Sort method.

A SortMode property value of DataGridViewColumnSortMode will not prevent the System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.ColumnHeaderMouseClick event from occurring, but it will prevent the header from changing its appearance when it is clicked.

ToolTipText

Gets or sets the text used for ToolTips.

public string ToolTipText { get; set; }
Value
String

The text to display as a ToolTip for the column.

Remarks

The column's ToolTip displays when the mouse pointer rests on the column header.

ValueType

Gets or sets the data type of the values in the column's cells.

public Type ValueType { get; set; }
Value
Type

A Type that describes the run-time class of the values stored in the column's cells.

Remarks

This property is used when filtering or sorting the columns with respect to the contents of their cells.

Visible

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the column is visible.

public override bool Visible { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the column is visible; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Use this property to hide a column from view while keeping the column in the DataGridView. To completely remove a column, use the Remove method.

To hide a column that is automatically generated when binding to a data source, set this property in a DataBindingComplete event handler.

Width

Gets or sets the current width of the column.

public int Width { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The width, in pixels, of the column. The default is 100.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The specified value when setting this property is greater than 65536.

Remarks

If the specified value when setting this property is less than the value of the MinimumWidth property, the MinimumWidth property value is used instead.

Methods

Clone()

Creates an exact copy of this band.

public override object Clone ();
Returns
Object

An Object that represents the cloned DataGridViewBand.

Dispose(Boolean)

Releases the unmanaged resources used by the DataGridViewBand and optionally releases the managed resources.

protected override void Dispose (bool disposing);
disposing
Boolean

true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

GetPreferredWidth(DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode,Boolean)

Calculates the ideal width of the column based on the specified criteria.

public virtual int GetPreferredWidth (System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode autoSizeColumnMode, bool fixedHeight);
autoSizeColumnMode
DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode

A DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode value that specifies an automatic sizing mode.

fixedHeight
Boolean

true to calculate the width of the column based on the current row heights; false to calculate the width with the expectation that the row heights will be adjusted.

Returns
Int32

The ideal width, in pixels, of the column.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

autoSizeColumnMode is DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode, DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode, or DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode.

InvalidEnumArgumentException

autoSizeColumnMode is not a valid DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode value.

Remarks

This property is used by the content-based automatic sizing feature of the DataGridView control to determine the ideal width of a column.

A fixedHeight parameter value of false calculates the column width based on calculated row heights that will achieve ideal cell height-to-width ratios. For cell contents to wrap onto multiple lines, the cell style in effect for the cell must have a WrapMode property value of DataGridViewTriState.

For more information about automatic sizing, see Sizing Options in the Windows Forms DataGridView Control.

ToString()

Gets a string that describes the column.

public override string ToString ();
Returns
String

A String that describes the column.

Remarks

This method overrides the ToString method. The returned string contains the Name and Index properties of the DataGridViewColumn.

Events

Disposed

Occurs when the DataGridViewColumn is disposed.

public event EventHandler Disposed;

Remarks

For more information about handling events, see NIB: Consuming Events.
